description: Tried Gnome-builder, found out was not feasible for small command line programs. Anjuta is absolutely the best for those who want to get to work without staring at all those weird build scripts, configuration files, etc.

I have used it for years, and dont even look for other choices.
I primary use it for C++ and Gtkmm , and it works perfect.

Especially when using it on a Raspberry PI (arm7) over ssh ,the build in glade editor comes in handy, for quick adjustment etc.

Only thing i have missed all years is a simple "namespace" option, if using the GUI to make a new class, should be obvious
Easy to use for beginners
can`t run my files...back to Geany!
summary: Program does not have an execution permission!

description: there is a problem here can't run my files , call terminal and too much hard work
summary: there is a problem here can't run my files too

description: eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee
Glade seems to be an issue running anjuta as root pushes through errors without exiting.
Just run sudo apt install libtool-bin and now you you can build normally.
summary: Anjuta can't find libtool error when building FIX

description:
This is the a great inroad into getting an app built for the Linux environment. The IDE designers tried to think of everything you might need here. However, like all tramlines systems this forces you down a line that is not the only way to get the job done. 

As others have already said here, Geany and Glade together with Make will do this job without the rails and when things go off the rails (which they will) you are Janjaweed up the creek without a paddle. 

In general it is (in my opinion) better to be free as in liberty to do it your own way. With this kind of IDE nd many others like it, you do not learn how the build process works AND there are a load of chaff files produced which just are not essential to creating an app unless you are using this system. So, as an IDE GEANY wins s it does not get in your way and you learn what the -f is going on!
1. app keeps crashing when there are multiple directory or files
summary: Crashed when loading directory with multiple files

description: not recommended. Every time I tried anjuta in the last couple of years, it crashes too often. A 'hello world' gtkmm-Projekt doesn't build.

Fresh installed it doesn't work. It ask to install libtool which is installed on my computer in the latest version. The package has obviously not idea where to find it. And I have no clue how to tell it.
He Buscado por mucho tiempo un programa que me permita gestionar interfaz grafica con Python y Anjuta me dio la solucion... de 10... excelente programa.

Hacía falta un IDE para Python que permitiera desde la misma interfaz diseñar la interfaz gráfica con GTK3. Anjuta cumple con creces, ofreciendo herramientas avanzadas para los desarrolladores avanzados con una interfaz sencilla que invita también a los novatos.
Para mejorarlo aun más solo le faltaría un mejor sistema de auto-completado de código y tutoriales.
Recomendado para creación de código e interfaz en C y Python

Me parece una herramienta ligera y útil. Es exactamente lo que busco cuando no quiero tanta dependencia entre IDE y lenguaje de programación. Que me deje hacer lo que yo quiera y en el lenguaje que quiera. Lo único que me incomoda es que no tenga modo nocturno. La claridad de área de desarrollo me quema las pupilas.
le logiciel se lance pas, je pars en dépression bisous les amis, je ne recommanderai point ce logiciel à mes confrères.
Comme souvent il manque des dépendances...qu'il est pas possible d'installer...ou qui sont introuvables....
impossible de le désinstaller simplement par le gestionnaire de logiciel sous xubuntu
Очень да же хорош.
Пользуюсь давно. Красиво, удобно. Особенно хорошо, что можно для С подключать библиотеки, не копаясь в настройках IDE, а просто проставив галочки...
Приложение как простой текстовый редактор с подсветкой синтаксиса , просто мусор.
